page.title: 17 CHANGING COUNTRYSIDE
page.content: Farmers report a large increase in the{badger}population but with no apparent adverse effect on livestock or crops.{Deer,}too, are rapidly increasing in numbers.{Foxes}are far fewer,probably because of the intense farming of the area disturbing their habitat. No{Sandmartins}have made it this year for the first time in living memory.The ever increasing African desert areas are presumed to be the cause.{Skylarks,}too,seem far fewer again because of the intense farming of the area interfering with their ground nesting habits.{Redstart and {Pied Flycatchers}are becoming more frequently seen.Ten times more{ {fertiliser}is being used than thirty years ago with productivity and high stocking rate being one of the most beneficial results.
